|wi2_if_name = |rad2chip1 = Broadcom;BCM4365E;BCM4365EKMMLWG, UE1708 P30, 463-14 3; |rad2oui = <!-- Only if different from above OUI --> |rad2_ant_conn = <!-- Leave blank for unknown --> |rad2txchains = 3 |rad2rxchains = 3 |rad2sstreams = 3 |rad2stand = IEEE 802.11a/n/ac |rad2ac = 1300 |nqam2 = <!-- 600, 750, 900, 1000 --> |rad2n = 450 |rad2a = 54 |rad2freq = 5 |rad2correv = <!-- core revision, Leave blank for none or unknown --> |rad2cap = <!-- radio capabilities, Leave blank for none or unknown -->

}}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== <!-- {{FCC ST|09/05/2017|indexme.}} --> Most of the information on this page was copied from the [[Netgear R8000P]] since the FCC ID is the same. The Netgear Board ID for both is ''U12H359T00_NETGEAR'' (OEM: [[Foxconn]]).
The 1.1.3.2 firmware downloads for the R7900P and the R8000P are identical which suggests that features may be disabled using other means. This router appears to be a feature-limited R8000P [[List of Costco Exclusive Wireless Devices|exclusively for Costco]]. Changes from the R8000P to this R7900P include the removal of the USB 2.0 port and of acqam for both the 2.4GHz and 5GHz radios which reduces the maximum speeds from 750Mbps to 450Mbps for 802.11n and from 1625Mbps to 1300Mbps for 802.11ac.
*Debug URL: http://192.168.1.1/debug.htm
==Links of Interest== ===More Info=== *[https://www.costco.com/NETGEAR-Nighthawk-X6S-AC3000-MU-MIMO-Smart-Wi-Fi-Router.product.100369549.html On '''costco.com''']
